intro: Mallotus fuscescens, commonly known as the black mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of the Americas, particularly in tropical and subtropical areas. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black bark and its ability to thrive in saline and waterlogged soils. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces yellowish flowers followed by small, woody fruits. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and providing habitat for various species.
